intro: Arnoglossum album, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, white ray florets surrounded by yellow disk florets, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, and it typically grows in moist, open habitats. Arnoglossum album is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
